Is it worth learning how to use a reference management system such as Zotero? Maybe. 

The hours you invest in learning how to use Zotero (approx. 10 hours) are likely to pay off, as they will save you a lot of time that you would otherwise spend formatting, revising and correcting references. In addition, this skill would become part of your skill set.

- [A great guide](https://library-guides.ucl.ac.uk/zotero/installing-zotero)

- [Free, online webinars in which you could participate and ask questions](https://library-guides.ucl.ac.uk/zotero/further-help)

- [Zotero and Word](https://library-guides.ucl.ac.uk/zotero/using-zotero-with-word)

- [Zotero extension for the Chrome browser, to quickly add papers to your libraries](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/zotero-connector/ekhagklcjbdpajgpjgmbionohlpdbjgc)
